span: Defective Samsung S23 FE phone charger received, Poor Seller support response received!
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
review-text: I ordered a renewed Samsung S23FE from this company for my wife and noticed when un-boxing that the charging adapter was dented, and also that this was not a Samsung charger.  I was able to charge the phone after un-boxing so thought nothing of it. The next day I moved the SIM Card, contacts, calendar, pictures, etc.  Afterwards, I thought  I should re-charge the phone.  This time when charging, the phone would cycle off and on as if I had unplugged and re-plugged the charger back into a wall outlet.  Also, I noticed that when I touched the charger it was extremely hot as well.  "Very HOT." I grabbed my charger from my personal Samsung phone and the issue went away.  I then put the charger just received with the S23 on my phone and the same thing happed… cycling on and off and extremely hot! I called Amazon and after explaining all the troubleshooting I had completed agreed the charger needed replaced.  They said I would receive an email from “the Seller” as to next step. I received the below…. SELLER REPLIED: Sorry to hear that you’re having issue with charging. Here are some quick-fix you can try: 1. Turn off your phone and check the charging port for any dirt or debris (use a flash light if needed) 2. Use a slim toothpick or sim ejector, gently pick and remove any dirt you saw. 3. You may also try a different outlet / adapter / charging cable to find out if the problem is coming from the accessories. 4. Update the phone may help fix any glitches with the software preventing fast-charging. I then called Amazon back and they contacted the seller who said they couldn’t replace the Adapter itself but that I would have to return the newly received S23 with the defective adapter and they would then send another S23 with a new adapter.  This doesn’t seem a viable solution as I’d spent a large amount of time and effort moving the SIM Card, contacts, calendar, pictures, downloading apps, reestablishing user name and passwords, etc. I resolved to just purchase another charging adapter, but the Amazon associate took it a step farther and resolved the issue thru Amazon and not the seller.  What GREAT support Amazon gives!  What poor support options “the Seller" gives.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2025
review-text: After a year, phone will no longer charge. Repair shop couldn't fix as it was not a problem with the charging port but 'some other problem with the phone itself'.  Expensive paperweight.  No more refurbished phones for me anymore.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2025
review-text: The phone is heavy and charges very slow.  It has been on the charger for four hours and still not 100%.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2025
review-text: Slow  response music quality not great was a refurbished well not purchase ever again battery life so so.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2025
review-text: It does support 5g, only supports 4g. Very disappointing Quality: Good,  but it doesn't support 5g network

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
review-text: Listing clearly stated that the phone was unlocked. When I attempted to set it up with my carrier I was told the phone was locked.

span: Item had features that didn't work
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2024
review-text: Unhappy with item and did request money back which I did get. Good communication with seller.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2025
review-text: Whether you are charging, or just scrolling, this phone gets incredibly hot, fast exceeding the safe working temperature recommended for the battery. I have been warned by the phone that it's exceeding 110 degrees nearly every day for the past year. I would pass on this model.
